Package danaus

The danaus package contains all the internals and implementation of the Danaus framework.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DirectionCondition
    A callback interface invoked by a map's neighbor retrieving methods.
    TileCondition
    A callback interface invoked by a map's neighbor retrieving methods.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractButterfly
    Class AbstractButterfly contains the infrastructure needed to implement a subclass Butterfly but leaves method run() abstract.
    Aroma
    An instance represents an aroma.
    Cliff
    An instance represents an unpassable cliff.
    Common
    A utility class with a miscellaneous set of functions used commonly by Danaus' code.
    Debugger
    A debugging tool shed, Debugger has many useful debugging tools that can help log a program, check for null parameters, etc.
    DirectionConditions
    Anonymous classes can get annoying to instantiate inside a function call.
    Entity
    An instance represents a physical entity that can be situated on, yet exist independently of, a tile.
    Flower
    An instance represents a flower.
    Forest
    An instance represents a thick forest.
    GUI
    An instance represents the central GUI element for a butterfly simulation.
    GUIButterfly
    An instance represents an animated butterfly.
    GUIMap
    An instance represents the GUI representation of a map.
    GUIState
    An instance represents the box on the right side of the GUI, which displays information about the game.
    GUITile
    An instance is a graphical representation of a tile on the map.
    GUITileInfo
    An instance is the box on the very right of the GUI that displays information about the tile that was most recently clicked.
    Land
    An instance represents a plain piece of ground.
    Location
    An instance represents a pair of integer Cartesian coordinates.
    Park
    An instance represents the park on which a butterfly flies.
    ParkState
    An instance represents a park's state.
    Power
    An instance represents the power of a butterfly.
    Randomer
    An instance is a pseudorandom number generator with more to offer than the standard Random class.
    Simulator
    An instance represents the heart of Danaus' simulation engine.
    Tile
    An instance represents a map tile.
    TileConditions  
    TileConditions.Flyables
    Tiles that can be flown to.
    TileConditions.Lands
    Land tiles.
    TileConditions.Nulls
    Null tiles.
    TileConditions.Obstacles
    Tiles that cannot be flown to.
    TileState
    An instance represents the state of a tile.
    Water
    An instance represents a square of water.
    Wind
    An instance represents one unit of wind, which has a non-negative intensity and a cardinal direction.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    An instance is one of 8 cardinal directions.
    SimulationPhase
    The possible states of a simulation.
    Speed
    An instance represents a speed a Butterfly can travel.
    TileType  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CliffCollisionException
    This exception is thrown when a butterfly attempts to fly into a cliff.
    DirectionFormatException
    Thrown when a direction is parsed from a string but the string's format is invalid.
    NoPowerException
    Thrown when a Butterfly runs out of power.
    ObstacleCollisionException
    An instance is thrown when a Butterfly flies into something it shouldn't.
    PrematureCollectionException
    Thrown when a Butterfly tries to collect a flower in learning mode.
    WaterCollisionException
    Thrown when a butterfly attempts to fly over water.
    WindFormatException
    Thrown when Wind.parseWind(String) is given an illegal argument.

Package danaus Description

The danaus package contains all the internals and implementation of the Danaus framework. Students should not modify files in the danaus package, as the grading harness will use an unmodified version of the danaus package. However, it is recommended that students browse the implementation of Danaus to gain a strong familiarity with the system.
